text: Pucajasa (possibly from Quechua puka red, q'asa mountain pass, "red mountain pass") is a mountain in the Urubamba mountain range in the Andes of Peru, about high. It is located in the Cusco Region, Urubamba Province, Urubamba District. It lies at the pass named Pumahuancajasa (possibly from Quechua for "Pumahuanca pass"). Looking towards Pumahuancajasa from southeast of Pucajasa ==References== Category:Mountains of Peru Category:Mountains of Cusco Region
title: Pucajasa (Urubamba)
